info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Montgomery and northwestern Philadelphia Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 300 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chestnut Hill, or near Philadelphia, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Norristown, Conshohocken, Ambler, Jenkintown, Narberth, Rockledge, Abington, Plymouth Meeting, Germantown, Chestnut Hill, Willow Grove, King Of Prussia, Bridgeport, West Conshohocken, Fort Washington, Blue Bell, Glenside, Flourtown and Oreland. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 329 and 341. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 22. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 330 and 339. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 16 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
